Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.
        Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing using the following news titles and content. Closely follow how CNBC techcheck chooses context to put into the script, the langauge style and sentence structure. Use the same beginning and ending(including mentioning host Wall-E and Monday September 22), and replace CNBC techcheck briefing to 'AI briefing' 
 ""

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, september 22nd. in today's top story, amazon has unveiled its newest addition to the echo lineup, featuring enhanced ai capabilities and improved sound quality. the tech giant is aiming to solidify its dominance in the smart speaker market with this release, which comes just in time for the holiday season.

meanwhile, microsoft has announced its plans to expand its data center footprint in india, investing billions over the next five years. the move is seen as part of microsoft's strategy to bolster its cloud presence in asia and tap into the rapidly growing digital economy of the region.

back in the u.s., twitter is reportedly testing a new subscription service that offers an ad-free experience and exclusive tweet features. this development comes as the social media platform looks for ways to diversify its revenue streams amidst increasing competition and evolving user preferences.

finally, shares of intel are on the rise today after the company announced a breakthrough in its next-generation chip technology, promising significant performance improvements and energy efficiency. this announcement is expected to bolster its position in the semiconductor industry, which has been facing various challenges due to global supply chain disruptions.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, september 22nd. 

amazon has just unveiled the latest addition to its echo lineup. the new models boast enhanced ai capabilities and improved sound quality. this move aims to solidify amazon's stronghold in the smart speaker market as the holiday season approaches. 

switching gears to microsoft, the company has announced plans to expand its data center footprint in india. microsoft is set to invest billions over the next five years, a strategic move to bolster its cloud presence in asia and tap into the region's rapidly growing digital economy. 

back in the u.s., twitter is reportedly testing a new subscription service that promises an ad-free experience along with exclusive tweet features. this initiative comes as twitter seeks to diversify its revenue streams in the face of increasing competition and shifting user preferences.

in other news, shares of intel are on the rise today. the company has announced a breakthrough in its next-generation chip technology, offering significant gains in performance and energy efficiency. this advancement is expected to strengthen intel's position in the semiconductor industry amidst ongoing global supply chain challenges.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-371 Amazon's Echo Upgrade 🎶, Microsoft's India Expansion 🇮🇳, Twitter's Ad-free Subscription 🐦
Podcast Description:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, september 22nd. dive into the latest updates:

  • amazon echo advancements: introduction of new models with enhanced ai features and improved sound quality, strategically released as the holiday season approaches.
  • microsoft's india expansion: plans to invest billions over the next five years to expand data center footprint, enhancing cloud presence in asia's booming digital economy.
  • twitter's potential subscription service: testing a new ad-free model with exclusive tweet features as part of efforts to diversify revenue amidst growing competition.
  • intel's chip technology breakthrough: unveiling of next-generation chips with significant gains in performance and energy efficiency, poised to boost intel's standing in the semiconductor industry.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow.
Image Prompt: a cohesive podcast cover image capturing an interconnected world through technological advancement. in the center, a sleek amazon echo device subtly glows with soft blue light, diffusing sound waves that ripple outward, symbolizing enhanced audio capabilities. to the left, a vibrant and dynamic skyline of an indian city like mumbai, bustling with energy, represents microsoft's expansion in india. modern skyscrapers with digital overlays hint at a tech-driven future with nodes connecting them, signifying innovation and growth. on the right, the iconic twitter bird takes flight into the sky, leaving behind a trail of varied symbols—like ads crossed out—depicting its shift towards an ad-free subscription model. the elements blend seamlessly into a unified representation of global technological evolution, emphasizing interconnectedness and progress
